gunicorn.arbiter

Classes

Arbiter

Arbiter maintain the workers processes alive. It launches or

Module Contents

class gunicorn.arbiter.Arbiter(app)[source]

Bases: object

Arbiter maintain the workers processes alive. It launches or kills them if needed. It also manages application reloading via SIGHUP/USR2.

num_workers[source]
setup(app)[source]
start()[source]

Initialize the arbiter. Start listening and set pidfile if needed.

init_signals()[source]

Initialize master signal handling. Most of the signals are queued. Child signals only wake up the master.

signal(sig, frame)[source]
run()[source]

Main master loop.

handle_chld(sig, frame)[source]

SIGCHLD handling

handle_hup()[source]

HUP handling. - Reload configuration - Start the new worker processes with a new configuration - Gracefully shutdown the old worker processes

handle_term()[source]

SIGTERM handling

handle_int()[source]

SIGINT handling

handle_quit()[source]

SIGQUIT handling

handle_ttin()[source]

SIGTTIN handling. Increases the number of workers by one.

handle_ttou()[source]

SIGTTOU handling. Decreases the number of workers by one.

handle_usr1()[source]

SIGUSR1 handling. Kill all workers by sending them a SIGUSR1

handle_usr2()[source]

SIGUSR2 handling. Creates a new arbiter/worker set as a fork of the current arbiter without affecting old workers. Use this to do live deployment with the ability to backout a change.

handle_winch()[source]

SIGWINCH handling

maybe_promote_master()[source]
wakeup()[source]

Wake up the arbiter by writing to the PIPE

halt(reason=None, exit_status=0)[source]

halt arbiter

sleep()[source]

Sleep until PIPE is readable or we timeout. A readable PIPE means a signal occurred.

stop(graceful=True)[source]

Stop workers

Attr graceful:

boolean, If True (the default) workers will be

killed gracefully (ie. trying to wait for the current connection)

reexec()[source]

Relaunch the master and workers.

reload()[source]
murder_workers()[source]

Kill unused/idle workers

reap_workers()[source]

Reap workers to avoid zombie processes

manage_workers()[source]

Maintain the number of workers by spawning or killing as required.

spawn_worker()[source]
spawn_workers()[source]

Spawn new workers as needed.

This is where a worker process leaves the main loop of the master process.

kill_workers(sig)[source]

Kill all workers with the signal sig :attr sig: signal.SIG* value

kill_worker(pid, sig)[source]

Kill a worker

Attr pid:

int, worker pid

Attr sig:

signal.SIG* value
